result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:33 PM Defendant Todd Bryan Harrington in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court sets cash bond of $300 with conditions:  Maintain absolute sobriety. No driving whatsoever. Curfew from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traverling to and from work.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned Initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
